overview: VS Code 1.104 focuses on safer and more flexible agent workflows: auto model selection (preview), confirmation for edits to sensitive files, AGENTS.md-based instructions, and an improved changed-files experience in agent mode. It also revises terminal auto-approve UX and settings, enables math rendering by default, and adds improvements to semantic search and AI feature controls.

detailed_explanation.title: Auto model selection (preview)
bullets: Introduces an Auto option in the model picker that selects between multiple models (Claude Sonnet 4, GPT-5, GPT-5 mini, GPT-4.1) depending on availability and policy.
Describes a variable model multiplier and notes a 10% request discount for paid users when using Auto.
Selected model and multiplier can be inspected by hovering over the chat response.

detailed_explanation.title: Safety: confirm edits to sensitive files
bullets: Agent mode now asks for confirmation before editing certain file patterns (setting(chat.tools.edits.autoApprove)).
Common system folders, dotfiles, and files outside the workspace require confirmation by default.
This is framed as an additional safety layer to reduce accidental or malicious edits to critical configuration files.

detailed_explanation.title: AGENTS.md as chat context (experimental)
bullets: Adds support for automatically picking up an AGENTS.md file from workspace root(s) as context for chat requests.
Support is enabled by default and can be controlled with setting(chat.useAgentsMdFile).
The notes link to agents.md for more information about the format and intended usage.

detailed_explanation.title: Improved changed files experience
bullets: Changed files list is collapsed by default but still shows counts and line deltas.
Files are removed from the changed list when changes are kept/accepted.
Staging or committing via Source Control automatically accepts proposed file changes.

detailed_explanation.title: Terminal auto approve and global auto approve hardening
bullets: Adds an explicit opt-in flow for enabling terminal auto approve and provides UI to add rules for commands.
Shows warnings when agent mode pulls content from the internet using common tools (curl/wget/Invoke-WebRequest/Invoke-RestMethod).
Renames global auto approve to setting(chat.tools.global.autoApprove) and adds a prominent warning the first time it is used.

detailed_explanation.title: Semantic search and AI controls
bullets: Upgrades the #codebase semantic search embeddings model, reducing storage and improving search results.
Introduces setting(chat.disableAIFeatures) to disable and hide built-in Copilot AI features (chat, completions, next edit suggestions).
Adds a skip option for tool call confirmations so users can bypass a tool call and let the agent continue.

detailed_explanation.title: Math rendering now enabled by default
bullets: Math rendering in chat responses is generally available and enabled by default (setting(chat.math.enabled)).
Uses KaTeX with $...$ inline and $$...$$ block equation syntax.

key_changes: Auto model selection (preview) in the model picker.
Confirmation required for agent edits to sensitive files with configurable patterns.
Automatic inclusion of AGENTS.md as chat context (experimental, enabled by default).
Reworked changed-files list behavior for agent mode.
Terminal auto-approve gains explicit opt-in UX and improved rule management; internet-fetch warnings added.
Global auto-approve renamed and gated behind a more explicit warning.
New embeddings model for semantic workspace search (#codebase).
Setting to disable/hide Copilot AI features across chat/completions/NES.
impact: Organizations can improve safety posture for agent edits by requiring confirmation for sensitive file patterns.
Teams using multiple AI agents can centralize agent guidance via AGENTS.md and have it applied automatically.
Users can reduce cognitive load during agent sessions with a more compact changed-files list and automatic acceptance when staging/committing.
Copilot users gain simpler model choice via Auto and more transparent per-response model/multiplier visibility.
Developers who prefer non-AI workflows can disable AI features via a single setting.
caveats: Auto model selection is described as preview and is rolling out over weeks; exact rollout timing and eligibility details beyond what is stated are not provided in the article.
AGENTS.md support is described as experimental and controlled by a setting.
The set of default terminal auto-approve rules is referenced as viewable in settings.json; the full list is not enumerated in the article text.
insights: The release prioritizes ‘safe autonomy’: enabling agents to do more while adding guardrails (sensitive file confirmation, clearer auto-approve).
There is a clear shift toward team-scale AI workflows, with AGENTS.md and prompt-mode improvements aimed at standardization.
Operational transparency is emphasized (model/multiplier visibility, warnings for internet downloads, skip tool calls).
